applications.name: Microsoft PowerPoint
applications.description: Microsoft PowerPoint is a presentation application used for creating, editing, and delivering slideshows with text, images, animations, and multimedia content.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and O together to open the file browser dialog where you can select a presentation to open.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the dialog and file list. Navigate files with arrow keys and press Enter to open.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and S together to save the current presentation. Opens Save As dialog for new presentations.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce save confirmation or present Save As dialog for unsaved files.

shortcuts.description: Press F12 to open the Save As dialog where you can choose location and filename for your presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Focus moves to filename field. Screen readers announce dialog and current filename.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P together to open the print dialog where you can configure printer settings and print slides.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce print settings. Tab through options to select layout and number of copies.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and N together to create a new blank presentation with a title slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new presentation created. Focus moves to title placeholder.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and W together to close the current presentation. Prompts to save if there are unsaved changes.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce any save prompt before closing.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then F to open the File backstage view for accessing file operations.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce backstage view. Use arrow keys to navigate menu options.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected in placeholder or text box
shortcuts.description: Press Control and B together to make selected text bold or toggle bold off if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce bold formatting when applied, depending on verbosity settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and I together to make selected text italic or toggle italic off if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce italic formatting depending on verbosity level.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and U together to underline selected text or toggle underline off if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce underline formatting based on user settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and F together to place focus in the font dropdown for changing font family.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce font dropdown and current font. Type to filter or use arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and P together to place focus in the font size dropdown.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce font size dropdown and current size value.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Greater Than together to increase font size to the next available size.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce new font size depending on settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Less Than together to decrease font size to the next smaller size.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce reduced font size when format reporting is enabled.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F3 together to cycle through text case options: sentence case, lowercase, uppercase, and title case.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically do not announce case changes. Use review commands to verify.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Equals together to format text as subscript.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce subscript formatting when reading character attributes.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Equals together to format text as superscript.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce superscript when reading character attributes.

shortcuts.context: When text or paragraph is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and E together to center align the selected paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce center alignment when reading paragraph attributes.

shortcuts.context: When text or paragraph is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and L together to left align the selected paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce left alignment in paragraph formatting.

shortcuts.context: When text or paragraph is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and R together to right align the selected paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce right alignment when checking paragraph format.

shortcuts.context: When text or paragraph is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and J together to justify the selected paragraph to both left and right margins.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce justified alignment in paragraph attributes.

shortcuts.context: Available in Normal or Slide Sorter view
shortcuts.description: Press Control and M together to insert a new slide with the same layout as the current slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new slide created and slide number. Focus moves to title placeholder.

shortcuts.context: When slide is selected in Slide Sorter or thumbnail pane
shortcuts.description: Press Control and D together to create a duplicate copy of the selected slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce slide duplicated and new slide number.

shortcuts.context: When slide is selected in Slide Sorter or thumbnail pane
shortcuts.description: Press Delete to remove the selected slide from the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce slide deleted and move focus to next slide.

shortcuts.context: In Normal view or when editing
shortcuts.description: Press Page Down to navigate to the next slide in the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new slide number and slide title if present.

shortcuts.context: In Normal view or when editing
shortcuts.description: Press Page Up to navigate to the previous slide in the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous slide number and title.

shortcuts.context: In Normal or Slide Sorter view
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Home together to jump to the first slide in the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce slide one and read slide title.

shortcuts.context: In Normal or Slide Sorter view
shortcuts.description: Press Control and End together to jump to the last slide in the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce final slide number and title.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then H then L to open the slide layout gallery for changing the current slide layout.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce layout gallery. Use arrow keys to navigate layouts and Enter to apply.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or cursor is positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Control and K together to open the Insert Hyperlink dialog for adding links to text or objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce hyperlink dialog. Focus moves to URL field for text entry.

shortcuts.context: When slide or object is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and M together to insert a comment on the current slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce comment pane and place focus in comment text field.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N then X to activate text box drawing mode. Click or drag to place text box.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text box mode active. Use arrow keys to position and Enter to place.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N then T to open table insertion interface for adding tables to slides.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce table grid or dialog. Specify rows and columns using arrow keys or input fields.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N then P to open picture insertion options for adding images to slides.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce picture menu. Choose from file, online, or other sources.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N then C to open chart insertion dialog for adding charts to slides.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce chart type selector. Navigate chart types with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N then S then H to open shapes gallery for inserting shapes on slides.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce shapes menu. Navigate shape categories and types with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Tab to move focus forward through text placeholders and objects on the current slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce each placeholder or object type and any text content as focus moves.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Tab together to move focus backward through placeholders and objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous placeholder or object as focus moves backward.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and A together to select all objects on the current slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce number of objects selected on slide.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and A together when in text editing mode to select all text in the current placeholder.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text selection with character or word count.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Right Bracket together to move selected object forward one layer in stacking order.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically do not announce layer changes. Visual positioning only.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Left Bracket together to move selected object backward one layer.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not announce layer order changes.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then H then G then R to bring selected object to the front of all other objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce object arrangement command but not visual result.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then H then G then K to send selected object to the back behind all other objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce send to back command without describing visual result.

shortcuts.context: When text or object is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and X together to cut selected text or objects and place on clipboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce content cut to clipboard.

shortcuts.context: When text or object is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and C together to copy selected text or objects to clipboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce content copied to clipboard.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and V together to paste clipboard content at cursor position or on slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce paste occurred. Navigate to pasted content to hear details.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Z together to undo the last action or edit.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce what action was undone depending on verbosity.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Y together to redo the last action that was undone.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce redo action completion.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F together to open the Find dialog for searching text in the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Find dialog and place focus in search field.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and H together to open Find and Replace dialog for searching and replacing text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog. Tab between Find and Replace fields.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and G together to group selected objects so they can be moved and formatted together.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce objects grouped. Group can now be manipulated as single unit.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and G together to ungroup objects so they can be edited individually.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce objects ungrouped and available for individual selection.

shortcuts.description: Press F5 to start the slide show presentation from the first slide in full screen mode.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce slide show starting. May have limited functionality during presentation depending on screen reader.

shortcuts.action: Start slide show from current slide
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F5 together to start the slide show from the currently selected slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce slide show starting from current position.

shortcuts.description: Press N during a slide show to advance to the next slide or animation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may not announce slide changes during presentation mode. Spacebar and arrow keys also advance slides.

shortcuts.description: Press P during a slide show to go back to the previous slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may have limited announcements during slide show mode.

shortcuts.description: Press a slide number then Enter during a slide show to jump directly to that slide.
shortcuts.notes: Type the number then press Enter. Screen readers may not announce the navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press Escape to end the slide show and return to editing view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce return to editing mode and current slide.

shortcuts.description: Press B during a slide show to black out the screen or return from black screen.
shortcuts.notes: Useful for pausing presentation focus. Screen readers may not announce screen state.

shortcuts.description: Press W during a slide show to white out the screen or return from white screen.
shortcuts.notes: Creates pause effect during presentation. Screen readers may not announce.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P during slide show to display pointer options and slide show controls.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce menu opening with pen and pointer tool options.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then L to switch to Normal view for editing slides with thumbnails pane.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Normal view activated. Standard editing layout.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then I to switch to Slide Sorter view for seeing all slides as thumbnails.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Slide Sorter view. Navigate slides with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then P then O to switch to Outline view for editing text content of slides.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Outline view. Best for screen reader users to edit slide text.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then P then N to switch to Notes Page view for adding speaker notes.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Notes Page view. Navigate to notes area to add content.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then Q to open Zoom dialog for setting slide magnification level.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce zoom dialog. Type percentage or select preset zoom level.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then R to toggle the ruler display on or off in editing view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically do not announce ruler visibility. Visual aid for positioning.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and F9 together to toggle alignment guides on or off for positioning objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not announce guide visibility. Visual positioning aids.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then G to open Grid and Guides settings dialog.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog with options for grid spacing and snap settings.

shortcuts.action: Move to next cell in table
shortcuts.context: When cursor is in table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Tab to move to the next cell in the table row or first cell of next row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell position and content as you navigate through table.

shortcuts.action: Move to previous cell in table
shortcuts.context: When cursor is in table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Tab together to move to the previous cell in the table.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous cell position and any text content.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in last cell of table
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Enter together when in last table cell to add a new row below.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new row creation and move focus to first cell of new row.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Home to move to the first cell in the current table row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce first cell of row and any content.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in table cell
shortcuts.description: Press End to move to the last cell in the current table row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce last cell of row and content.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then R then A then 1 to open Accessibility Checker pane showing accessibility issues.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce pane and list issues. Tab through to review each accessibility problem.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then J then P then Y to open Alt Text pane for adding descriptions to images and objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Alt Text pane. Focus moves to description field for entering alternative text.

shortcuts.context: When object or text is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F10 together to open context menu for selected object or text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce context menu and available commands. Navigate with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then H then F then D then O to open Selection Pane showing object reading order.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Selection Pane. Reorder objects to improve screen reader navigation sequence.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then A then P to open Animations pane for adding and managing animations.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Animations pane. Navigate animation list with arrow keys.

shortcuts.context: When animations are applied to slide
shortcuts.description: Press Alt then A then V to preview all animations on the current slide.
shortcuts.notes: Animations play in editing view. Screen readers may not fully describe animation effects.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then K to activate Transitions tab for applying slide transitions.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Transitions tab. Navigate transition options with Tab and arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt to display key tip badges showing letters for accessing ribbon tabs and commands.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce key tips activated. Press displayed letters to navigate ribbon.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then H to activate Home tab ribbon with formatting and slide commands.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Home tab active. Continue with keys for specific commands.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N to activate Insert tab for adding content to slides.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Insert tab active.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then G to activate Design tab for themes and slide design options.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Design tab activated.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then K to activate Transitions tab for slide transition effects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Transitions tab active.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then A to activate Animations tab for object animation effects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Animations tab activated.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then S to activate Slide Show tab for presentation settings.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Slide Show tab active.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then R to activate Review tab with comments and accessibility tools.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Review tab activated.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W to activate View tab for controlling presentation views.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce View tab active.
